intro: Scaevola graminea, commonly known as the silverleaf fanflower, is a perennial flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. It is often used in coastal landscaping due to its hardiness and ability to withstand salt spray. Scaevola graminea is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
